entries: {@b SCHEMA:}
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut
A construct you touch takes 2d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier force damage. This spell has no effect on non-constructs.
For every extra Infusion point you add, damage increases by 1d8.

spell.name: Globe of Invulnerability

components.m: a glass or crystal bead that shatters when the spell ends

entries: {@b SCHEMA:}
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut
An immobile, faintly shimmering barrier springs into existence in a 10-foot radius around you and remains for the duration.

Any spell of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells.

entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the barrier blocks spells of one level higher for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Orb of Ectoplasmic Disruption
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Dismiss
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Hour

This orb has 1 charge. When casting a spell, the wielder of this orb can expend 1 charge to have the spell ignore the resistances of one creature with the incorporeal movement feature. This expends 1 infusion point.
For every extra infusion point you spend, the orb gains an additional charge.

spell.name: Neutralizing
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Protection from Poison, Purify Food and Water, Lesser Restoration
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Hour per 5ft cube storage  [10 minutes]
When put the infused object has food or water placed within it, it is rendered free from poison or disease.
If made as an consumable, a creature which uses it the target is cured of one disease or poison and has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned for until they complete a short or long rest.
For every extra infusion point you spend, you remove an additional disease or poison when consumed or an additional 5 cubic feet of material is purified.

spell.name: Metamagical Alchemical Tinkering
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Fabricate, Bless
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut
This weapon, armor or equipments gains a properties of your choice:  (this is a material change, not magical in property and as such isn't subject being dispelled or suppressed by Anti-Magic fields.

items: {@b Silvered} - treat as silvered
{@b Blessed} - (requires bless) treat as holy symbol or holy water if contact is maintained for a minute.

{@b Lightened} - reduce its weight by 50%  (For Heavy Armor reduce Strength requirements by 1 but this cannot be "stacked" - it's  a one time only modification). Weapons drop 1 step of a die down (ie d10 becomes d8; d8 becomes d6; etc (d4 remains d4);  -- weapons dealing d6 or less damage damage gain the "light" weapon property

{@b Dense} -  Double its weight  (For Heavy Armor increase Strength requirements by 1 but this cannot be "stacked" - it's  a one time only modification; Weapons with the Light property lose that property; ranged weapons lose 20ft on their short range, but long range remains)
{@b Altered appearance} - Changes color or minor physical aspect  (you may use this to create aesthetic changes - ie translucent steel (not invisible),golden leather, etc

entries: If this is done every day for 30 days the weapon permanently has the property

spell.name: Burdenless
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Enlarge, Enhance Ability
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

Burdenless objects (armor, boots, sacks) magically lightens the weight of the wearer's load more efficiently, allowing her to carry more without suffering the effects of encumbrance. The wearer's carrying capacity effectively doubled (as if the creature is one size larger).

spell.name: Calming/Raging
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Calm Emotions
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

As a consumable, you create a balm that upon breaking every humanoid within 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, suppress any effect causing a target to be charmed or frightened for 1 minute. When this effect ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

As a wearable (Cloak/Broach/Armor etc) - the item takes upon a blue or pink hue. This item has 1 charge. The wearer may expend a charge to as reaction to generate a 10foot radius zone for 1 minute, inside of which the above effect is maintained, unlike the balm, leaving the zone immediately resumes the previous condition, provided its duration has not expired in the meantime.  Raging creatures (Including Mindless Rage) who fail their save, have their rage ended.

{@b REVERSED}: (Wearable only - item takes on a blood red and black tint) - Expend a charge as above - Target's within 10 feet who fail their saves become angry - for the projectile they will attack the nearest creature (if they leave the effect they stop raging at the start of their next round. For clothing the wearer is the target of the attack(s). Creatures with Rage are granted an additional use of Rage.
For every extra four infusion points you spend, the item gains an extra charge and the radius increases by 5 feet.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Continual Flame
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

spell.name: Carrion Crawler Toxin
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} none
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

A character can use the poison in this vial to coat one weapon, or a single piece of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon must make a Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

m.text: 2sp of Charcoal and Ice and The object [Reusable]

entries: @B COST:} The object and 2sp of Charcoal and Ice  [Reusable]
{@b SCHEMA:} Prestidigitation, Resistance
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hour per 100 gp of value [10 minutes]

An item with this infusion always looks immaculately clean, can be slept in, and is resist the effects of extreme heat (advantage on saves for Heat Metal). In cold weather, it counts as cold-weather clothing.

spell.name: Creation

components.m: a tiny piece of matter of the same type of the item you plan to create

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} none
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

You pull wisps of shadow material from the Shadowfell to create a nonliving object of vegetable matter within range: soft goods, rope, wood, or something similar. You can also use this spell to create mineral objects such as stone, crystal, or metal. The object created must be no larger than a 5-foot cube, and the object must be of a form and material that you have seen before.
The duration depends on the object's material. If the object is composed of multiple materials, use the shortest duration.

1 minute

spell.name: Light
entries: @B COST:} Object (less than 5 lbs) [Reusable]
{@b SCHEMA:} Light or Continual  Flame or Daylight
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

The item shines with bright light for 20 feet, and dim light 20 feet beyond that. The wielder or wearer of the item may turn this ability on or off, or even change the color of the light as a bonus action. If the object is Infused everyday for 30 days it becomes permanent.

If the Artificer has Continual Flame they may spend 2 additional points to make the object permanent immediately, these infusion points are for this permanency only, otherwise For every extra infusion points spent, the light extends an additional 10ft  and the object can be 5 lbs heavier.  [Doing this increases the cost to 50gp]
If the Artificer spends an additional 5 points, the object gains 1 charge, using the charge generates the effects of a Daylight spell for one hour.

spell.name: Master's Wand of Cure Wounds
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Leczenie ran
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

This wand has 1 charge. The wielder of this wand can expend 1 charge to cast Cure Wounds as a 1st-level spell, using your Intelligence modifier as his or her spellcasting ability modifier. This expends 1 infusion point.
When casting Cure Wounds, the wielder of this wand can expend 1 charge and increase the casting time of Cure Wounds to 1 minute to treat all dice as having rolled the maximum amount.
For every extra two infusion point you spend, the wand gains either an additional charge or each charge heals an additional 1d8 damage.

spell.name: Master's Wand of...

m.text: Cost of  Arcane Focus Wand/Staff/Rod [Reusable] + 10gp per level

entries: {@b INFUSION POINT COST:} 1+(varies)
{@b COST:} Cost of  Arcane Focus Wand/Staff/Rod [Reusable] + 10gp per level
{@b SCHEMA:} varies (see below)
{@b CRAFTING TIME:}  1 hour + 10 minutes per spell level

You create this wand by spending 2 infusion point per level of spell schema being imbued within the wand. The spell imbued requires the Artificer be able to cast it, have the schema in your book, and its spell level cannot be greater than your proficiency bonus.  The wielder of this wand can expend 1 charge to cast the spell with a spell attack bonus equal to your infusion attack bonus.
Spending infusion point(s) equal to the 2 x the spell's level you spend grants the wand an additional charge.
{@i Wands of non attack spell cantrips have infinite charges, but last only 12 hours.}

m.text: 4 leaf clover picked on a harvest moon(15gp) & Luckstone [recycle]

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} guidance or bless
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 8 hours (1 hour)

This item has 1 charge. The wearer or wielder can expend a charge to reroll a saving throw(armor), attack roll(weapon), or skill check (other).  OR the wearer/wielder can  +add or -subtract 1pt for each charge they expend - the modifier can never spend more than their proficiency modifier in the roll - ie it cannot modify an untrained skill/save/ or attack.
The new roll MUST be used, abilities that allow you to roll again are suspended.
For every three extra infusion points you spend, the item gains an extra charge.

spell.name: Liquid Void
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Darkness
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

As an action, a character can throw a vial of liquid void up to 60 feet. The liquid void releases a burst of magical darkness that extends 15 feet out from where the vial fell. The magical darkness lasts for 1 minute. Creatures that enter the void or start their turn their take 1d8 cold and 1d8 necrotic damage.

items: At 6th Level - d10 Cold and d10 Necrotic (20ft)
At 12th Level - 2d6 cold and 2d6 Necrotic (25ft)
At 18th Level - 2d8+3 cold and 2d8+3 Necrotic (30ft)

spell.name: Weapon of Banishment
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Banishment, Magic Weapon, Banishing Smite
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hour [1 minute]

When you hit an summoned or extraplanar creature with the weapon (or up to 20 arrows/bolts or bullets) attack, your weapon crackles with force, and the attack deals an extra 1d6 force damage to the target. Additionally, if the attack scores a critical hit or reduces the target to 20 hit points of fewer, The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished.

entries.name: OF SPECIAL NOTE
items: {@b Buff Bomb ({@spell Aid}) - The effect is granted to the two closest creatures to the bomb's detonation point. Granting each +5 Max HP and Current HP. You may additionally spend 2 extra Infusion points to either increase the number of people affected by 2 or increase the Max HP and current HP by 5.
{@b Shatterstorm {@spell Cloud of Daggers} - Deals 2d4 slashing Damage. The AoE is considered difficult terrain for those passing through it.
{@b Lunar Bomb} ({@spell Moonbeam}) - It creates a sphere of the light, and may be made into a ball, which will roll down slopes, otherwise for the duration the bomb's effect remains stationary.

{@b Spikeshot} ({@spell Spike Growth}) - The area is embedded with shards of glass and stone, this includes walls and surfaces, anyone in the area takes 2d4 piercing if they fail a Dexterity Save - there is no camouflage option. Otherwise, the area becomes difficult terrain and deals damage per the spell's description.

{@b Truth Gas} ({@spell Zone of Truth}) - whether a creature is or is not affected by the Gas is not known. A Creature starting its round inside the area attempting to lie, must make a Charisma save or speak the truth. DC increases by 2 for each round in the gas.

A stiff breeze will disperse the effect temporarily. The area effected over the next year doubles.

{@b Tendril Bomb} ({@spell Plant Growth}) - Adjustment to the AoE All normal plants in a 100-foot radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.
If the Artificer spends an additional 2 points the AoE for either of these increases by 25% instead of 5ft.

entries.name: OF SPECIAL NOTE
items: {@b Beacon {@spell Antipathy/Sympathy}} -  The AoE is always only 60ft,  the Beacon(Bomb) itself is the target, though it can be hidden - the beacon only lasts for 12 hours once activated.
{@b Breach Bomb} ({@spell Passwall}) - Per the spell - ignore the AoE
{@b {@spell Cloudkill}} - The Bomb may roll away if designed to do so, otherwise the area of effect remains, though the gas may sink if within the AoE there are gaps/holes through which it can do so.
{@b Coldsnap} ({@spell Cone of Cold})

{@b Forcebubble} ({@spell Wall of Force} or {@spell Forcecage}) - A Sphere, Cube or hemisphere forms at the radius of the AoE. The shape is static - the effect never makes specific wall. The bomb is commonly painted Red and White.

{@b Heal Bomb} ({@spell Mass Cure Wounds}) - 16d8 + 12 points are healed, divided (round down) equally amongst every creature (excluding Undead and Constructs) in the AoE, no creature may regain more than 25hp however.

{@b Plague} ({@spell Contagion}) - All creatures in the AoE are subject to the effect. Destroying the Bomb will not end the disease effect prematurely, the Bomb's disease AoE aura lasts 24 hours once activated, not 7 days.

{@b Stone Bomb} ({@spell Wall of Stone}) - the shape is set during the bomb's creation. When set off the Bomb generates the Wall, at the end of 10 minutes - the wall disappears. If the Artificer spends - 3 additional Points, the wall remains after 10 Minutes.
{@b Void Bomb} ({@spell Maelstrom}) - Double the Area effect when used on/in water.

{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

entries.name: Bombs
entries: PostaÄ‡ moÅ¼e uÅ¼yÄ‡ tej Bomby (zasiÄ™g 30/60) do stworzenia AoE o promieniu 10 stÃ³p. Efekty zaklÄ™cia sÄ… ograniczone do AoE Bomby - jeÅ›li zaklÄ™cie oznacza SzeÅ›cian, StoÅ¼ek lub Cylinder, jest ono ograniczone do sferycznego obszaru dziaÅ‚ania Bomby. Istota fizycznie uderzona wyzwolonÄ… bombÄ…, ratuje siÄ™ (jeÅ›li jest to dozwolone) z minusem.

JeÅ›li Artificer posiada schemat Magicznych Ust lub Alarmu, moÅ¼e stworzyÄ‡ bombÄ™, ktÃ³ra jest bombÄ… czasowÄ… (np. detonuje w okreÅ›lonym czasie lub granatem po okreÅ›lonym czasie od rzucenia/postawienia) lub minÄ™ (bomba, ktÃ³ra detonuje po okreÅ›lonym wydarzeniu/wyzwoleniu). OdnieÅ› siÄ™ do specyficznych kryteriÃ³w kaÅ¼dego z zaklÄ™Ä‡, aby dowiedzieÄ‡ siÄ™, co jest moÅ¼liwe do wyzwolenia.
Kiedy schemat zaklÄ™cia bomby ma czas trwania, bomba moÅ¼e byÄ‡ skierowana na zniszczenie trwajÄ…cej natury efektu.

Bomby majÄ… AC 16 i HP 5 + 2 na poziom Artificera); Bomby, gdy zostanÄ… zniszczone, muszÄ… rzuciÄ‡ d20, na 8 lub mniej - zadadzÄ… 1d6 force dmg na punkt infuzji przechowywany w nich wszystkim w ich promieniu AoE (Dex Save dla poÅ‚owy obraÅ¼eÅ„).

entries.name: Modifications
entries: Za kaÅ¼dy dodatkowo wydany punkt infuzji moÅ¼na zwiÄ™kszyÄ‡ zasiÄ™g o 10/20.
Za kaÅ¼de wydane dwa dodatkowe punkty infuzji promieÅ„ AoE zwiÄ™ksza siÄ™ o 5 stÃ³p lub efektywny poziom zaklÄ™cia wzrasta o 1.

entries.name: OF SPECIAL NOTE
items: {@b {@spell Disintegrate}} - Upon a successful hit, the creature saves (as stated at disadvantage) and the damage is resolved. If the bomb misses, determine the AoE, roll the damage - starting with the lowest HP item and/or creatures in the area - resolve the damage, disintegrating everything that reaches 0hp, then moving the remaining damage to the next creature and/or Item.
{@b Ice Bomb} ({@spell Otiluke's Freezing Sphere}) - The AoE at creation may be up to 60ft, and any additional investment of Infusion points will extend this.
{@b Napalm} ({@spell Immolation}) -  the target is for all in the AoE. The AoE cannot be increased.

{@b Portal} ({@spell arcane Gate}) - the device comes in two parts. The first may be thrown or placed, the next is likewise thrown or placed - they must be no more than 500ft apart.  The gates open upon one of the devices being triggered, most often by the person setting them.
{@b Safety Zone} ({@spell Globe of Invulnerability}) - the AoE on this cannot exceed 20ft radius.

{@b CRAFTING TIME:}  10 Minutes

As other items (and In addition for shield), whenever a creature makes a ranged weapon attack against a target within 5 feet of you, you can use a reaction to become the target of the attack.

spell.name: Armor, Volcanic

m.text: add 2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs.[Reusable]

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} fog cloud, a fire damage spell, and  Arms of Hadar
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} +1 Hour (10 minutes)
{@i This infusion may only be used on an enchanted suit of armor. It cannot be the only enchantment.}

Once per day, the wearer can command the armor to erupt, causing a cloud of smoke and hot molten liquid to shoot forth from the armor in a 10-foot radius centered on the wearer. The smoke provides half concealment, and the liquid deals 1d6 points of fire damage and ignites flammable substances. One round after the armor erupts, the smoke clears and the liquid cools and solidifies, creating difficult terrain. The wearer of this armor isn't affected by the smoke, fire damage, or difficult terrain created by this armor. Nor by Heat Metal being cast upon it.
For every 3 additional infusion points spent, the armor gains another charge.

spell.name: Armor, Veil of Undeath

m.text: 1 corpse or 15lbs of bones and the suit of Armor [recycle]

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Feign Death, Nondetection
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hours (10 Minutes)
{@i You have advantage on saving throws against the charmed, exhausted, and frightened conditions, and resistance to necrotic damage.}

In addition, Undead creatures must make a Wisdom (Insight) check with a DC equal to your infusion saving throw DC to determine you are a living creature. On a failure, they believe you to be an Undead creature unless you attack or given them reason to save again.
The armor must be repaired or replaced at the end of the spell.

spell.name: Armor, Undead Controlling

m.text: 2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Animate Dead, Suggestion, Sleep
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} +1 Hour (10 minutes)

As an action, you may channel divinity. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. Roll 4d8, the total is how many hit points of creatures you can affect of those that fail their save. They are effectively charmed and they are subject to a collective command and act under such while you maintain concentration.  You may issue new commands to them, but each time you do creatures affected by such are allowed another Wisdom Save.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Enlarge, Animate Object
{@b CRAFTING TIME:}  42 Hours (1 hour)

This armor has 1 charge. Armor Infusions with this enhancement - is comically oversized, but the Creature within is able to operate normally and considered proficient, even it they normally would not be. A creature wearing this armor counts as one size category largely for purposes of special attacks.
Use of the charge grants Enlarge, with a duration of 1 minute and expends 1 Infusion Point.
For every extra infusion point you spend, the armor gains an additional charge or the armor my spend another minute enlarged.

This armor has 1 charge. When the wearer of this armor is hit by an attack, he or she can spend her reaction to expend the charge. Doing so causes the armor to cast Thunderwave, with a saving throw DC equal to your infusion saving throw DC.
For every two extra infusion points you spend, the armor gains an additional charge.

spell.name: Armor, Stanching

m.text: one time cost: add 2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs. [Reusable]

entries: {@b SCHEMA:}  Spare the Dying
{@b CRAFTING TIME:}  +1 Hour (10 minutes)
{@i This infusion may only be used on an enchanted suit of armor. It cannot be used by itself.}

A stanching suit of armor helps stop the flow of blood from the wearer's wounds, automatically tightening like a tourniquet in the appropriate places while also magically reducing the severity of the wound. Stanching armor grants resistance to slashing damage.  The wearer also adds the armor's enhancement bonus and Constitution Ability modifier to Death saves to become stable, on a modified 20+ you recover

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} none
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} +1 Hour (10 minutes)

This armor's ability functions only if its wearer has the panache,rage, or Superiority Dice class feature. When a melee attack made by an enemy within the wearer's melee reach would reduce the wearer to fewer than 0 hit points, the wearer can spend their reaction. This allows her to make a single melee attack against the creature that reduced her to 0 hit points or fewer. This occurs prior to the wearer falling unconscious or dead.

spell.name: Armor, Spell Storing
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} counterspell, dispel magic
{@b CRAFTING TIME:}  +1 Hour (10 minutes)

Once per day as a reaction, the shield or Armor can command the armor or shield to "counterspell" spell, spell-like ability, or magical ability created by a magic item that specifically targets only the creature. It cannot absorb spells, spell-like abilities, or item effects that target an area or multiple targets. The attacker creating the magical effect to be absorbed must succeed at a DC 14 Will saving throw or the shield or armor absorbs and neutralizes the effect. The Counterspell acts as if it was cast at 3rd level, for each additional infusion point invested, the effective Counterspell spell slot, increases by one.
For 3 additional Infusion points the Armor gains an additional charge.

spell.name: Death Note
entries: {@b ATTUNED:} Yes
{@b SCHEMA:} Finger of Death or Powerword Kill
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Hour

This creates a dark book that radiate with necromantic magical energy. The wielder writes a name of a known target within 120ft. The name must be the target's actual name, it does not work if on a target whose real name you do not know. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes 7d8+30 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
For every 6 points extra you spend, you gain an additional charge and you may write another name.
(With Powerword Kill - Provided this book has a free charge, If the creature you chose was dropped to 100 hit points or fewer, it dies immediately. Otherwise, This feature doesn't apply.)

spell.name: Armor, Spell Storing
entries: {@b INFUSION COST:} 2 + (2 x Spell Slot Level) infusion points
{@b SCHEMA:} none
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} +1 Hour (10 minutes

This armor allows a spellcaster to store a single touch spell of a level up to the additional infusion points spent within it. Anytime a creature hits the wearer with a melee attack or melee touch attack, as a reaction the wearer can have the the armor can cast the spell on that creature with automatic success. Once the spell has been cast from the armor, a spellcaster can cast any other targeted touch spell of up to the designated spell slot level into it To reload the spell.

spell.name: Armor, Restful

m.text: 1,000gp + (2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs.) [Reusable]

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} feign death
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} +1 Hour (10 minutes)
This infusion may only be used on an enchanted suit of armor. It cannot be used by itself.

A suit of restful armor permits the wearer to reduce the amount of uninterrupted sleep or rest she needs from 8 hours to 2 hours, and the wearer does not become fatigued by sleeping in this armor. She recovers hit points and ability damage and endures diseases, poisons, or other afflictions as if she had slept through the night in a comfortable bed, awakening refreshed. Additional rest time in this armor does not confer extra healing (as would be gained with complete bed rest), nor can the wearer benefit from the armor's effect more than once per day.

spell.name: Armor, Poisoning

m.text: 200gp (each time), and a one time modification costing (2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs [Reusable])

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} poison splash
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 8 Hours (10 minutes)

The user must slip a vial of 1 dose of the poison (contact, injury, or ingested) into a hidden slot along the armor's inner thigh. Three rounds afterward, the entire suit of armor becomes infused with the poison; any creature that grapples with the wearer (if an injury poison is used) or that successfully hits the wearer with a bite attack (if an ingested poison is used) is immediately exposed to the poison and must save accordingly. Whether or not the victim successfully saves, the poison is discharged from the armor and the wearer must load a new vial into the armor to recharge this ability.

items: At 6th Level - the poison is magically restored after a short rest.
At 12th Level - Can load 2 doses of the poison, both of which are magically restored after a short rest.
At 18th Level - Can load 3 doses of the poison, all of which are magically restored after a short rest.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Immolation
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 8 Hours (1 Hour)

This armor has 1 charge. When the wearer of this armor is killed, fire erupts from the corpse. All hostile creatures within 30 feet of the wearer must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 6d8 fire damage and be blinded for 1 minute, halving the damage and being blinded for only 1 round on a successful save. The wearer is then immediately brought back to life with 1 hit point. This expends the charge and all infusion points.

spell.name: Armor, Merging

m.text: 50gp, a one time modification costing (2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs [Reusable])

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} mage hand
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 8 Hours (10 minutes)

A merging shield can meld with a held one-handed or light weapon. The wearer chooses each round whether to attack with the weapon or defend with the shield. Melding or freeing the shield is a bonus action. The shield must be worn to merge it with a weapon; reversing the melding means the shield is being worn again. While the shield is melded, the wearer can use that hand only to attack with the weapon or defend with the shield (and not to cast spells or manipulate objects, for example). Attack rolls with the weapon are at disadvantage while merged with the shield. If the wearer attacks with the merged weapon, she loses the shield's bonus to AC until the start of her next turn. A merged shield can't be used to shield bash.

m.text: one time 500gp modification costing and (2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs  [Reusable])

entries: {@b SCHEMA:}  mass cure wounds, Contingency
{@b CRAFTING TIME:}
{@i This infusion may only be used on an enchanted suit of armor. It cannot be used by itself.}

This armor allows the wearer to capitalize on her own injuries to heal her allies. Once per day as an immediate action, when an enemy critical hits against someone wearing martyring armor or the wearer is reduced to 0 Hp, as a reaction the wearer can heal up to nine allies within 30 feet (3d8 hit points each). This special ability cannot be placed on armor that possesses an ability that reduces the attack chance of or negates a critical hit (such as the fortification enhanced infusion ability).

m.text: 150gp and (2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs  (Reusable))

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} enhanced ability, phantom mount
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 24 Hours (10 minutes)

The armor or shield has 1 charge. A shield or set of armor with this ability causes unpleasant resonant vibrations in weapons that strike its wearer. When the wearer is struck by a melee attack, as a reaction,  may expend a charge to send jarring vibrations back through the weapon. The attacker must succeed a Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of their next round.
For every three extra infusion points you spend, the armor gains an extra charge.

spell.name: Armor, Hosteling

m.text: 300gp and (2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs [Reusable])

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Leomund's Secret Chest, Conjure Animal, Beast Bond
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 24 Hours (10 minutes)

A suit of armor or shield with this special ability hides living animals within its iconography to keep it safe. The wearer can speak a command word to magically store an animal to which they are bonded, such as an animal companion, a familiar, trained pet, or mount. The stored animal appears as a symbol emblazoned upon the armor or shield, either one that mimics the appearance of the animal or that is more symbolic and abstract.

While stored, the animal is sleeping and provides the wearer no benefits. The size and number of animals that can be stored depends on the type of armor or shield. A suit of light armor (one creature, one size smaller than the wearer), medium armor bracers or a light shield (One creature Same size as wearer (Medium)); A suit of heavy armor, tower shield (one size category larger than the wearer (Large)). As a bonus or attack action, A second command word releases the stored animal from the hosteling armor or shield. A released animal immediately awakens, appears in a space adjacent to the wearer, and can take actions on the round it appears. Magical armor grants additional space, one additional space of the size the armor and its wearer allow, or 2 spaces of one category size smaller.

Because the stored animal is sleeping rather than in suspended animation (or even hibernating), it ages and gets hungry at the normal rate while stored. A hosteling armor or shield automatically releases a stored animal 24 hours after it was stored inside.
This armor special ability still works on bonded magical beasts that were once animals(Beasts), but not celestials,fiends, oozes, or other templates for companion creatures.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Shield of Faith
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Hour (10 Minutes)

As a reaction, a paladin or good priest wearing this armor can expend one use of Channel Divinity to activate the armor's protective aura for 1 minute. This protective aura grants the wearer a +4 sacred bonus to AC and saves against creatures of Fiends, and Undead. (Evil Paladins or Priest gain the bonus versus Celestial, Fey.)

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Pass without trace, Darkness
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 2 Godziny (10 minut)
While in darkness, the wearer of this armor is invisible. The armor can also not be detected by blindsight or tremorsense regardless of light conditions.
If you spend an additional 5 infusion points, the wearer of this armor gains these benefits in darkness and dim light.

spell.name: Armor, Deceiving
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Detect Good and Evil, Nondetection, Locate Creature
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 3 Hours (1 minute)

A suit of armor with this special ability alters the perceived aura of the wearer for the purpose of divination spells that reveal auras (such as detect evil) to an aura decided when the armor is enchanted. The wearer always radiates this alternate alignment aura while wearing a suit of deceiving armor, and cannot suppress this effect. The wearer does not count as having this modified alignment for effects other than detection, and spells that have alternative effects based on a target's alignment. If the wearer is struck by an attack or effect that is more effective against evil-aligned creatures, the attacker perceives the strike as being far more effective than it actually is. Insight checks against the wearer are at disadvantage.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Move Earth
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 12 Hour, (10 Minutes)
{@i This infusion may only be used on an enchanted suit of armor. It cannot be the only enchantment.}

Armor with this special ability grants the wearer a burrow speed of 10 feet. This speed allows the wearer to tunnel through any type of soil, including rocky soil, but not actual solid stone. This special ability does not give the wearer the ability to breathe underground, so he must hold his breath or use other magic that provides air or allows him to breathe.

When a critical hit or sneak attack is scored on the wearer, there is a chance that the critical hit or sneak attack is negated and damage is instead rolled normally. You may make a Constitution save versus the attack roll's value

Armor and shields with the frosted ability are coated in a thin layer of frost, making the armor or shield shimmer faintly and take on a bluish-white hue. The armor deals 1d8 cold damage every round to creatures that constrict, pin, or swallow the wearer whole (Grappled).

entries: {@b SCHEMA:}  Mage Armor, Spike Growth
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 8 Hours (10 minutes)

A shield or suit of armor with this special ability is covered with jagged burrs and razor-sharp serrations that saw and grind whenever the wearer is grappled or entangled. Any creature with which its grappled takes damage equal to the armor or shield's enchantment bonus (with each successful check) as the barbs and blades bite into it. This special ability counts as armor spikes for the purpose of making attacks on the wearer's turn.
For an extra infusion point, the damage increases to 1d4 + enchantment bonus.

m.text: 400gp and (2x the cost of the armor and other infusion costs [Reusable])

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Mage Armor, Spike Growth
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 24 Hours (10 minutes)

Every step taken in harmonizing armor produces a symphony of sounds. The armor harmonizes with music played, lyrics sung, and words spoken by its wearer, creating a pleasant counter-melody. Its wearer gains a +5 bonus  on Perform checks, but takes a–5 penalty on Stealth checks. The wearer can be silent only if he takes no physical actions. The armor also amplifies harmful sounds, and the wearer gains vulnerability to thunder damage.
If the wearer has the Charisma (Performance (Musical Instrument/Singing)) skill, the harmonizing grants advantage for ability checks with such.
The harmonizing ability can be applied to any armor, but not shields.

spell.name: Cup of Gruel (aka The Gaggin Flaggon)

m.text: a cup[Reusable] and optional (*2,500 in gems [Reusable]]

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Create Food/Water, optional (Prestidigitation or Hero's Feast)
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut
This cup starts with 9 charges. Spending a charge fills the cup with a nourishing, but tasteless gruel that will service as one meal for a medium size creature.
For every extra point your spend the cup gains another 9 charges.
If you have Prestidigitation the Gruel will have a taste (but, all the meals will have that same flavor)

If you spend 6 or more points additional points and if you use 2,500gp in gemstones for the cup [reusable] the cup gains another ability; for 6 charges the gruel becomes extraordinarily savory and mirrors a Hero's Feast.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Shocking grasp, Enhanced Ability, Guidance
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut
The wearer of this belt deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage with their unarmed attack(s) (which count as a magic weapon), and gains +4 bonus to Strength (Athletics) skill checks and Strength Saves.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Goodberry, Lesser Restoration
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 min.
This creates a Lollipop that if sucked upon will grant a creature a full day's nutrition. The infusion makes 10 + the artificer's level of "Berrypops"
For every extra point spent, an additional 10 lollipops are created.  If 10 or more points are spent the berry pops grant advantage on Constitution saves against disease for the day.

spell.name: Weapon, Berzerker's Bloodthirst

m.text: 2d4 damage to Max HP for its wearer/wielder from blood loss [Reusable]

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} magic weapon, crown of madness
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Hour [10 minutes]
{@i This infusion may only be used on an already enchanted item. It cannot be the sole infusion/enchantment.}
Jagged designs of lightning, fangs, or vicious looking weaponry adorn an item infused with Berzerker's Bloodthirst.
The item promotes wanton bloodshed, as its enhancement bonus increases by 1 for 1 round after its wearer deals damage with a natural attack or melee weapon.
If the wearer of a suit of bloodthirsty armor is raging, the armor's enhancement bonus increases by 2 instead.
A creature may only benefit from one such item each round.

spell.name: Weedkiller
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Plant Growth
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 Min.

As an action, a character can throw the vial of Weedkiller up to 30 feet. Make a ranged attack against the target, treating the vial as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d10 necrotic damage if it is a plant. Otherwise, the Weedkiller has no effect.

items: At 6th Level - 2d12
Na 12 poziomie - 3d10
At 18th Level - 3d12

entries: For every two extra infusion points you spend, the Weedkiller deals an extra 2d10 + 2 damage.

spell.name: Potion of...(1)
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} (Absorb elements, Aid, Bless, Friends, Resistance, Comprehend Languages, Expeditious Retreat, False Life, Heroism, Longstrider, Protection from Evil and Good, Purify Food and Drink, Sanctuary, Speak with Animals, or Shield of Faith)
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

As an action a creature can drink this potion, depending upon the schema being imprinted, that spell effect is put into place (consumer only) for up to 1 minute without using the Artificer for concentration (use the drinker's Constitution). If the Schema has multiple options, that must be chosen at the time of potion's creation. If another potion is consumed before the previous has expired use the {@table Potion Miscibility Mishap|MMMxArtificer}.

entries.name: OF SPECIAL NOTE
items: {@b {@spell Potion of Purity}} - is consumed directly protecting the imbiber from poisonous foods or drink until the next short or long rest, alternately it can be poured onto or mixed into 5 ft x 5ft cube of food to remove poison or rot from the food (doesn't help the taste though).

spell.name: Pennant of the Void
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Hallow
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hour

As an action you may plant the pennant in the ground.  While it is in place any creature transporting within 60 feet of it they gain the poisoned condition for 1 minute (Constitution Save for Â½ duration).
For every extra infusion point you spend, the radius increases by 10ft or add 1 minute to effect's duration.
If you spend 6 or more points, the save is at disadvantage.

spell.name: Pending Potion
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} none
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

You delay the effect of a consumable (This may be standard magical potion) until activated by a designated creature (as a reaction) - by default ist the imbiber. If its not used by the duration's end, the consumable is activated automatically.
{@i Example a potion of healing is put as Pending, by its drinker, within the next hour as a reaction they may choose to activate it, at the end of an hour it activates either way}

spell.name: Orb of Insidious Deception
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Truesight, Nondetection
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut
This orb has 1 charge. Illusions cast while wielding the orb spell DC increases by 1. The wielder of this orb can expend one charge. If the wielder does so, truesight does not pierce the illusion.
For every two extra infusion points, you spend, the orb gains an additional charge or the spell DC increases by 1 (max +3).

spell.name: Eldritch Poison
entries: {@b SCHEMA:}
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

A character can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon, or a single piece of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be affected by the poison for 1 minute. An affected creature must succeed on a Intelligence saving throw at the start of each round or take 6d6 necrotic damage and suffer 1 level of exhaustion. A successful save reduces the damage by half and ends the ongoing need to save each round effect. A creature that dies while affected by this poison crumbles to faintly glowing dust.
If the same creature is effected by multiple sources of Eldritch Poison the effects {@i do not stack}, but the creature saves are at disadvantage.

spell.name: Bottled Storm
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Storm Sphere or Investiture of Wind or Whirlwind
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 minutes

As an action, a character can throw a vial of bottled storm up to 120 feet. The vial releases a storm that extends 30 feet out from where the vial falls, and 150 into the air. This storm lasts for 1 minute. Winds cause ranged attacks through the storm to have disadvantage, and cause the air to be difficult terrain for flying creatures. Torrential rains cause the area to be heavily obscured.

Each creature that starts its turn in the storm or enters it must make a Dexterity saving throw or be struck by lightning, taking 4d8 lightning damage on failed save, and half as much on a successful save. Creatures wearing metal armor or made of metal have disadvantage on this saving throw.
The Storm Lasts up to 10 minutes.

For every extra three infusion points, you spend, the orb gains an additional charge.

spell.name: Essence of Green Slime
entries: {@b SCHEMA:}
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

As an action, a character can throw the vial of essence of green slime (30/60 feet). Make a ranged attack against the target, treating the vial as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d10 acid damage at the start of each of its turns and has disadvantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a Dexterity saving throw to clear off the essence of green slime.
For every extra infusion point you spend, the essence deals an extra 1d10 damage.

spell.name: Gravedust Poison
entries: {@b SCHEMA:}  Poison Spray, Finger of Death, Hex
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

A character can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon, or a single piece of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be affected by the poison for 1 minute. An affected creature has disadvantage on Strength attacks, ability checks, and saving throws, and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or take 3d8 necrotic damage and fall prone.

spell.name: Helm of the Wild Hunt
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Alter Self  and (Hunter's Mark and/or Misty Step)
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 godzina [10 minut]
This helm or similar piece of clothing grows antlers.
As an action, the wearer of this helm can make a Strength-based melee weapon attack with these antlers, dealing 1d6 piercing damage on a hit.
If the wearer of this helm casts the Hunter's Mark spell, the wearer always knows the direction to his or her quarry and the dmg from the antlers are increased to d8 piercing.
If the wearer of this helm can use Misty Step, they may do so up to 60ft as an action, this still uses a 2nd level spell slot (Or better). They are brought within 10 feet or their prey.

spell.name: Bottled Sunshine
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Sunbeam, or Sunburst
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

As an action, a character can throw a vial of bottled sunshine (30/90 feet). The liquid vial releases a burst of magical light that extends 30 feet out from where the vial fell. Creatures in the light must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 6d8 radiant damage, and be blinded for 1 minute. Undead creatures are also turned for the duration. Creatures with sunlight sensitivity or weakness have disadvantage on this saving throw. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
For every extra three infusion points you spend, the radius increases by 5 feet and the damage increases by 1d8

m.text: Armor and an Empty Vial of Potion of Healing

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Healing Word, Spare the Dying
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Week [10 minutes]
{@i This infusion may only be used on an enchanted suit of armor. It cannot be used by itself.}

This has 1 charge. When the wearer (if armor) or target (if weapon) is reduced to 0 hit points, as a reaction you can spend 1 charge;  and spend a HD to stabilize and (if this object is not a weapon) the wearer immediately regains one hit die of Hit Points.
For every six extra infusion points you spend, gain an additional charge.

spell.name: Alchemist's Frost
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Frostbite, Ice Knife, or Chill touch
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Minute

As an action, a character can throw the vial of alchemist's frost up to 20 feet. Make a ranged attack against the target, treating the vial as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 cold damage, and has its speed reduced by 10 feet for 1 round. If the creature's speed is reduced to 0 it is frozen (Grappled) in place, and must spend an action to break free, Strength (Athletics) check against Infusion DC.

items: At 5th Level - base 2d10 cold damage
At 10th Level - base 2d10 cold damage and speed is reduced by 15 for 1 round.
At 15th Level - base 3d10 cold damage  and speed is reduced  by 20 for 1 round.

entries: For every extra two infusion points you spend, the alchemist's frost deals an extra 1d10 + 2 cold damage, and reduces the target's speed by 5 more feet.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} lightning arrow, Magic Stone
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 2 Hours [10 minutes]

This weapon special ability can only be placed on ammunition (20 pieces). A creature struck by a piece of penetrating ammunition must succeed at Constitution save or the ammunition proceeds to travel striking the next creature in line. The second attack is made at a–3 penalty, in addition to any modifiers for added range. If successful, the target must make its own Constitution save or the shot continues (each additional gain an additional -3 penality to hit, in addition to any other modifiers for range).

spell.name: Ammunition, Phantom
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Goodberry, Magic Stone
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minut

This special ability can be placed only on ammunition (40 pieces of ammunition). The ammunition dissolves 1 round after it is fired. Additionally, if the projectile strikes true, the wound closes after the ammunition disintegrates. The weapon deals its normal damage -1, leaving behind no visible trace of foul play.

spell.name: Angelic Weapon
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Healing Spirit; Spiritual Weapon or (Magic Weapon and Bless)
{@b CRAFTING TIME:}
This weapon deals an extra 1d6 radiant damage.

In addition, this weapon has 3 charges. When the wielder hits with an attack, the wielder can expend a charge to allow one ally within 30 feet of the wielder to regain hit points equal to the extra radiant damage dealt. Doing so expends 1 charge. As an action, the wielder of this weapon can touch it to another creature and expend 3 charges to remove the effect of a single disease or poison from that creature.
For every two extra point you spend, the weapon gains an additional charge. If you spend eight infusion points, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 radiant damage.

(immune to Psychic, Charm or illusions).

spell.name: Arcane Sanctum Sanctorum
entries: {@b SCHEMA:}  Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum, Forbiddance, Hallow, Mordenkainen's Magnificent Mansion, or  Nondetection.
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 week (10 minutes)
You make an area you prepare over a week for your future infusions (10 minutes each) magically secure. The area is a cube that can be from 1 foot to as large as 100 feet on each side.
When you infuse it, you decide what sort of security the infusion provides, choosing any or all of the following properties:

items: Sound can't pass through the barrier at the edge of the warded area.
The barrier of the warded area appears dark and foggy, preventing vision (including darkvision) through it.
Sensors created by divination spells can't appear inside the protected area or pass through the barrier at its perimeter.
Creatures in the area can't be targeted by divination spells.
Nothing can teleport into or out of the warded area.
Planar travel is blocked within the warded area.

entries: For 1 Extra Infusion points per effect: Some of the following effects can be applied to specific creatures in the area; you can designate whether the effect applies to all creatures, creatures that follow a specific deity or leader, or creatures of a specific sort, such as ogres or trolls. When a creature that would be affected enters the infused area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it can make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature ignores the extra effect until it leaves the area.

entries.name: Bane:

items: Darkness -Darkness fills the area. Normal light, as well as magical light created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell, can't illuminate the area.
Energy Vulnerability - Affected creatures in the area have vulnerability to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Extradimensional Interference - Affected creatures can't move or travel using teleportation or by extradimensional or interplanar means.
Fear  - Affected creatures are frightened while in the area.

entries: When the chosen creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature takes 2d10 radiant or necrotic damage (your choice when you Infusion is made) : May increase 1d10 for every  2 addition Infusion Points spent.

items: Daylight - Bright light fills the area. Magical darkness created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell can't extinguish the light.
Courage - Affected creatures can't be frightened while in the area.
Energy Protection - Affected creatures in the area have resistance to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Everlasting Rest - Dead bodies interred in the area can't be turned into undead.
Tongues - Affected creatures can communicate with any other creature in the area, even if they don't share a common language.

entries: Crafting this infusion on the same spot every day for a year makes this effect permanent. Creatures that save versus a negative (Bane Effect) are immune to that effect for the day, re-entering the next day, they are again subject to the effects and must save, again.

spell.name: Ammunition, Blight
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} lightning arrow or Magic Stone; chill touch or inflict Wounds
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 2 Hours [10 minutes]

Necromantic energy washes over a creature struck, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes an additional 4d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This effect does nothing to undead or constructs.
If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.
If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw; it simply withers and dies.
For every two extra point you spend, the ammo deal an additional 1d8 necrotic damage.

entries: {@B SCHEMA:}  Hex, Magic Weapon
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hour [10 minutes]

This infusion can only be applied to weapons that deal piercing or slashing damage. A living creature hit by this weapon must make a Constitution saving throw or take 1 point necrotic damage at the start of every turn for 1 minute (stacks). The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of every turn, ending the effect on a successful save. Another creature can aid by making a Wisdom (Medicine) successful check, or healing the creature, thus ending the effect.

m.text: one time cost of 2x the weapon [reusable]

entries: {@B SCHEMA:}
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes

This special ability can only be placed on melee weapons. A nullifying weapon suppresses a creature's resistance for a short amount of time. Anytime the weapon strikes a creature with a resistance and the creature takes damage as it would normally, and until the start of your your turn the creature loses one resistance or has their immunity reduced to resistance. On a critical hit, the creature instead gains vulnerability to the damage type.

spell.name: Weapon, Ominous
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Magic Weapon, Eyebite, bane
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes
{@i This can only be placed on an already magical/enchanted melee weapons.}

An ominous weapon trails a shadowy haze behind every stroke, and moans a menacing dirge in battle. An ominous weapon adds its enhancement bonus on Intimidate checks made by the wielder. In addition, when an ominous weapon gets a critical hit, the target is affected by Bane (Charisma Save negates).  This condition lasts until the wielder strikes another creature. A creature that succeeds its save against a Band critical hit, cannot be the subject of such from the same weapon for 24 hours.

Upon a critical hit, the target gains  the Poisoned condition (Constitution save each round to remove the condition). If ever the creature is struck for real damage before they complete a short rest the temporary damage is removed.

spell.name: Weapon, Sharding
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Magic Missile,  Phantasmal Killer, and either (Mordenkainen's Sword or Spiritual Weapon)
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Hour [10 minutes]
{@i This may not be combined with other Infusions or spell like abilities that extend weapon damage.}

The wielder of a sharding weapon can take an action to make a ranged spell attack with the weapon in place of an attack action. To do this, the wielder goes through the motion of throwing the weapon without releasing it. The weapon splits off a Illusory duplicate of itself that flies as if thrown by the wielder at the intended target. The duplicate gains a range of 30/60 feet for this purpose. The illusory weapon deals Psychic damage and adds the wielder's spell ability modifier to damage dealt, but otherwise functions the same as the original weapon. The duplicate vanishes after hitting or missing its target, and leaves no marks.

spell.name: Weapon, Spell Stealing

m.text: one time cost of scroll of feeblemind or 100gp; weapon [reusable]

entries: {@B SCHEMA:}
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Day [10 Minutes]
{@i This infusion can only be placed on melee or natural weapons}

A spellstealing weapon allows its wielder to siphon magic from a target and transfer it to themselves. When the wielder rolls a critical threat against a target, they automatically learn which spells or magical effects are active upon the target. The wielder may then make an Arcana check against the spell DC to steal her choice of one of those effects, the spellstealing weapon's enhancement bonus is added to the Abilty check value. If the check succeeds, the target immediately loses the benefits of that effect and the wielder gains the effect for 1 minute (or until the effect expires).
If the creature has no effects; and is spellcaster - they instead lose one of their lowest availible level spell slots.

spell.name: Weapon, Stalking
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Magic Weapon, True Strike, Guidance; Hunter's Mark or Hex
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 day [10 minutes]

The longer the wielder of a stalking weapon studies a  target, the more effective her strike. As your action, a character wielding a stalking weapon can command  it to study a creature within 60 feet. The wielder must  have line of effect and line of sight to that target. When the wielder attacks the studied creature, on a successful hit the stalking weapon deals +1d6 points of bonus damage per consecutive round spent studying a target, up to a number of bonus dice equal to the wielder's proficiency bonus. This bonus damage is precision damage and only applies to the first successful hit against that  creature. If the wielder attacks a creature other than the studied creature, studies a different  creature, or ends her turn more than 60 feet from the studied creature, the weapon loses all bonus damage dice against the target.

{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hour [10 minutes]

When first infused, this weapon generates its own venom. The first time the wielder of this weapon hits with an attack after it has been envenomed, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 poison damage.  Upon a successful hit, the target makes a CON save or becomes {@condition Poisoned}; at the start of their next round they may choose to use a bonus action to and save to attempt to remove the {@condition poisoned} conition; which will run out after they save; or 1 minute passes.
For every three extra infusion points you spend, the poison damage dealt by this weapon increases by 1d4.

spell.name: Weapon, Tailwind
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Gust of Wind
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes
{@i This infusion can be placed only on ranged weapon attacks (Thrown or Projectile).}

Whenever a tailwind weapon is used to make a ranged attack, the weapon or its projectile is pushed along by a powerful tailwind that fills its space. It can still extinguish unprotected flames and accomplish anything a sudden burst of wind could. The tailwind negates range penalties to the weapon's attack; if the attack is successful within its standard range, the creature struck must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you.

spell.name: Weapon, Veering

m.text: Feathers + (cost equal to 1/10 the weapon's cost)

entries: {@B SCHEMA:} True Strike, Magic Missile
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 action

Ranged attacks with this infusion are adorned with feathers, the weapon (or up to 20 arrows/bolts/bullets) gain a +3 to bonus to attack rolls against creatures with partial cover, seeming taken by gust of divine guidance.

spell.name: Weapon, Throwing

m.text: 20 feet of rope (+10 feet per infusion point)

entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Magic Weapon and (Spiritual Weapon or Mage Hand)
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes
The weapon gains the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If its placed upon an already ranged/thrown weapon the weapon range increases by 20ft.
The Wielder may spend a bonus action to have the weapon(s) fly back to their hand after making an attack.
For every extra infusion point spent, the range increases in 10ft  increments.

spell.name: Weapon, Thundering
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Magic Weapon and (Spiritual Weapon or Mage Hand)
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes

A thundering melee weapon creates a cacophonous roar like thunder whenever it strikes a target with a successful critical hit. The thunder damage does not harm the wielder. A thundering weapon deals an extra 1d8 thunder damage on a successful critical hit.

When applied to Ranged weapons (up to 10 arrows, bolts, or bullets), the attack deals an additional 1d6 thunder damage to the target on a successful strike, as well as 1d6 thunder to in the path of the bullet (excluding the wielder).
Creatures dealt thunder damage must make a successful Constitution DC save or be deafened for up to 1 minute (They make an additional Constitution save each round to end Deafened condition).
For every two extra infusion points spent, the weapon's thunder damage increases 1 die.

spell.name: Weapon, Vampiric

m.text: 1 cup of the Wielder's Blood [1d6 MAX Hp Damage], and the weapon [Reusable]

entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Vampiric Touch,  Magic Weapon
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hour [10 minutes]
This weapon deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.
In addition, this weapon has 3 charges. When the wielder hits with an attack, the wielder can expend a charge to gain temporary hit points equal to the extra necrotic damage dealt.
For every 3 extra infusion points you spend, the weapon gains an additional charge.
If you spend nine extra infusion points, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.

spell.name: Bond Item
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} blink; dimension door; teleport or Leomund's Secret Chest
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Hour [10 minutes]
You touch a item weighing no more than {@homebrew 50|100} pounds and form a link between you and it. Until the spell ends, you can recall it to your hand as a bonus action.

If another creature is holding or wearing the item when you try to recall it, they make a Charisma saving throw, and if they succeed, the spell fails. They make this save with advantage if they have had possession of the item for more than 1 minute.

spell.name: Arcane Weapon
entries: {@B SCHEMA:}
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes
You touch a weapon and imbue it with magic. For the duration the weapon counts as a magical weapon, any damage dealt by it is Force damage.

classFeature.name: Polyglot
entries: During Character Creation - When choosing your background, if the background includes a skill you already have, rather than chose another skill, you instead learn an additional Language.
You gain an additional language every 4 levels after 1st (ie 5th, 9th; 13th; 17th;)

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to tangle and force the shape of the fabric of reality in discord to and in alignment to your wishes and as such spells are part of your repertoire. Its magic is something that you can use to co-opt and corrupt the efforts of others in situations. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the PHB for the general rules of spellcasting and below for the {@filter dirge spell list|spells|class=dirge|source=reddit_UA}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the Dirdge spell list. You learn additional Dirge cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the {@filter dirge spell list|spells|class=dirge|source=reddit_UA}.

entries.name: Spell Points
entries: The table above tells how many spell points you have to cast your spells. To cast one of these spells. you must expend one point per level of the Spell Slot of the spell you wish to cast. You regain half of all your expended spell slots when you finish a short rest, and all them on a long rest.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Dirge spells. Your magic comes from the ability to warp reality and force patterns, it is in part divine, and in part aberrant ability of your force of will bringing the world into more chaos. Use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a dirge spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast any bard spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an book focus (found in chapter 5) as a spellcasting focus for your dirge spells.

entries.name: Learning Spells of 1st Level and Higher
entries: Each time you gain a dirge level, you can add one dirge spells of your choice to your spellbook. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the {@filter dirge spell list|spells|class=dirge|source=reddit_UA} table. On your adventures, you might find other spells that you can add to your spellbook (see "Your Spellbook").

entries.name: Your Spellbook
entries: The spells that you add to your spellbook as you gain levels reflect the arcane research you conduct on your own, as well as intellectual breakthroughs you have had about the nature of the multiverse. You might find other spells during your adventures. You could discover a spell recorded on a scroll in an evil creature's library, for example, or in a dusty tome in an ancient library.
A spellbook doesn't contain cantrips.

entries.name: Copying a Spell into the Book
entries: When you find a spell of 1st level or higher that is on your spell list, you can add it to your spellbook if it is of a spell level you can prepare and if you can spare the time to decipher and copy it.

Copying a spell into your spellbook involves reproducing the basic form of the spell, then deciphering the unique system of notation used by the spellcaster who wrote it. You must practice the spell until you understand the sounds or gestures required, then transcribe it into your spellbook using your own notation.

For each level of the spell, the process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it. Once you have spent this time and money, you can prepare the spell just like your other spells.

A spell on scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When you copy a spell from a spell scroll, you must succeed on an Intelligence (Arcana) check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

entries.name: Replacing the Book
entries: You can copy a spell from your own spellbook into another book—for example, if you want to make a backup copy of your spellbook. This is just like copying a new spell into your spellbook, but faster and easier, since you understand your own notation and already know how to cast the spell. You need spend only 1 hour and 10 gp for each level of the copied spell.

If you lose your spellbook, you can use the same procedure to transcribe the spells that you have prepared into a new spellbook. Filling out the remainder of your spellbook requires you to find new spells to do so, as normal. For this reason, many casters keep backup spellbooks in a safe place.

entries.name: The Book's Appearance
entries: Your book is a unique compilation of spells, poems, music notation, and stains, with its own decorative flourishes and margin notes. It might be a plain, functional leather volume that you received as a gift from your master, a finely bound gilt-edged tome you found in an ancient library, or even a loose collection of notes scrounged together after you lost your previous spellbook in a mishap.

classFeature.name: Enervate
entries: You discourage others through biting words, rebukes, and statistical probabilities of their failure and eventual death at a loved one's hands.

To do so, you use a reaction to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear YOU. That creature rolls your Enervation die, a 1d6 at 1st level, and "subtracts" the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. You can choose to use this feature after the creature makes its roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll or ability check succeeds or fails, or before the creature does damage. If the creature can't hear, or doesn't speak your language the enervation fails. Creatures that are immune to Charm, or are Constructs are immune.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Your Enervation die changes when you reach certain levels in this class; at 5th level (d8), at 10th level (d10), and finally at 15th level (2d6).

classFeature.name: Expertise/Master of None
entries: Choose three of your skills proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that the chosen proficiencies. HOWEVER; After a long rest you temporarily lose any proficiency bonus in one skill you have (had) expertise until your next long rest (determined randomly).
You gain half of your proficiency bonus (or Your Intelligence Ability Modifier - whichever is greater) on all Tools, Kits, and Charisma-based checks with which you are non-proficient.
At 10th level, you can choose another two skill proficiencies to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Familiar
entries: At 2nd level you will acquire a familiar/animal companion.

This isn't a {@italic magical} familiar, if lost/killed it cannot be resummoned. It gains +2 HP with each level the Dirge obtains while with that familar.  If the familiar dies unlike a Ranger animal companions or wizard/warlock familars, you don't resummon it during a ritual long rest. No, you have to go find another one. You must buy/steal or coax it into your service if you need to replace it. Once the type of creature is chosen it is the one type that grants you those benefits alone. If you have a goat and then after its tragic (but expected) death, you cannot switch to a cat. You are stuck with a goat (or whatever).
Your familiar gains HP are also

classFeature.name: Emotionally Abusive
entries: You may add your Intelligence Modifier to any Psychic damage source you deal.

classFeature.name: Meh
entries: Starting at 4th level, you unlock similar powers similar to Warlock's Invocations called {@filter Mehs|optionalfeatures|source=reddit_UA} these are abilities, powers, or enhancements .

You may additionally choose from the following invocations from Warlocks: {@optfeature Bewitching Whispers}, {@optfeature Chains of Carceri}, {@optfeature Dreadful Word}, {@optfeature Eyes of the Run Keeper}, {@optfeature Fiendish Vigor}, {@optfeature Mask of Many Faces}, {@optfeature Mire the Mind}, {@optfeature Misty Visions}, {@optfeature Witch Sight}.

classFeature.name: Tough Love
entries: At 3rd level, you use a bonus action to use your biting tongue to compel a target creature within 60 ft. to redouble their efforts and do better. It is not nice, and its very pointed, but the target receives an enervation die or your Charisma Modifier to enhance an Attack roll To Hit, for Damage, Saves, Ability and Skill checks.

The Target Takes an enervation die of Psychic Damage to their Max HP until the die is used (after which the damage may be healed normally). Once given the recipient has 1 minute to use this die before or after they make a roll, but always before the DM determines whether the attack roll or ability is successful.

classFeature.name: Divine Filler
entries: At 3rd level, You really receive nothing from this.

But that's reality. However, at this seemingly arbitrary point in your development, you must choose a path of philosophy and develop toward such. You don't gain anything, but later on, you'll have to keep to your decision you make today...

items: {@bold Epistemological} - all knowledge is accepted as possibly untrue or unable to be known. Additionally, morality is seen as subjective or false.

{@bold Existential} - life has no intrinsic meaning or value. With respect to the universe, existential nihilism posits that a single human or even the entire human species is insignificant, without purpose and unlikely to change in the totality of existence.

{@bold Mereologic} - is the position that objects with proper parts do not exist (not only objects in space but also objects existing in time do not have any temporal parts), and only basic building blocks without parts exist, and thus the world we see and experience full of objects with parts is a product of human misrepresentation (i.e., if we could see clearly, we would not perceive compositive objects).

classFeature.name: Placebo
entries: At 3rd Level you gain the ability as an full round to use a placebo. Taking Water or wine, or whatever - you roll a performance check (action)

Upon administering the Placebo to a single creature (bonus action), the creature(s) makes a Wisdom save with disadvantage against your performance roll as the DC, if they fail they get better (2d4 temporary hit points), and 1 real hp. The creature and you must be able to understand each other for this to happen.
You may do this any number of times, sadly until a creature successfully saves against your Placebo.
Once a creature saves, That creature cannot benefit from your placebo, ever, and you may not use another placebo until a day has passed.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Disruptive Banter
entries: At 5th level, you gain the ability to use your Enervation to disrupt a single spell or mind-influencing effect. As an action, you can start a {skill performance} that lasts up to a minute. During that time, you and any allied creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed. And nonfriendly creatures are at disadvantage for such.

A creature must share a language and be able to hear you to be affected. The performance ends early if you are incapacitated or silenced or if you voluntarily end it (no action required). Hostile Creatures attempting to maintain concentration must make a save each against your spell DC. If their concentration is broken, they take d6 psychic damage as a backlash.

classFeature.name: Enervate (d8)
entries: Your Enervation die changes to (d8).

classFeature.name: Channel snort "Divinity"
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to channel so called {@bold divine} energy directly once per every long rest from your angst over the nature and paradox of divinity, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You must then finish a long rest to use your Channel Divinity again. Some Channel Divinity effects require saving throws.
When you use such an effect from this class, the DC equals your Dirge spell save DC.

Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests, and beginning at 18th level, you can use it three times between rests. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain your expended uses.

entries.name: Channel: Divinity
entries: As an reaction, you speak to a creature with that can hear and understand your language within 30 ft. has disadvantage imposed upon its roll.

classFeature.name: Troll's Regeneration
entries: Beginning when you reach 6th level, you regain all of your expended uses of Enervation when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Orator
entries: At 7th level, you gain the ability to use {@spell Tongues} (as the spell - but without spell components costs) once per rest. You regain the use of this when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Enervate (d10)
entries: At 9th level, your Enervation die changes to (d10).

classFeature.name: Expertise/Master of None (2)
entries: At 10th level, you can choose another two skill proficiencies, double the proficiency bonus for these skills, however you now lose proficiency with two skills at random per long rest.

classFeature.name: Philosophical Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gane a subclass feature from your chosen Philosophical Pact.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Philosophical Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gane a subclass feature from your chosen Philosophical Pact.

classFeature.name: Dark Thoughts
entries: Beginning at 10th level, your angst hones your mental fortitude. You have resistance to psychic damage, and whenever a creature deals psychic damage to you, as a reaction that creature takes half that damage. Attempts to gain insight into you are at disadvantage; you turn the mind-affecting magic of your enemies against them and you are immune to being charmed. When another creature attempts to charm you, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature, in addition that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be frightened by you for 1 minute.

classFeature.name: Shared Delusion
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can plunge a creature into an illusory realm. As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. It must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it is charmed or frightened by you (your choice made before their save) for 1 minute or until your concentration is broken (as if you are concentrating on a spell). This effect ends early if the creature takes any damage. Until this illusion ends, the creature thinks it is lost in a dark diasporic version of reality, the appearance of which you choose. The creature can see and hear only itself, you, and the illusion - the experience (if frightening) deals d8 psychic damage each round when the effect is ended they are frightened of you. If the effect was charming, they gain the belief they are healed and fully restored as if a long rest - they are not, and they'll think they are casting spells, using abilities they cannot use.
{@i You must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.}

classFeature.name: Enervate (d12)
entries: At 15th level, your Enervation die changes to (1d12).

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Philosophy feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Martial Archetype.

classFeature.name: Channel snort "Divinity"
entries: At 18th level, you can channel 3 times per long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: A cookie
entries: at 20th level, you get...
.... a Cookie.
Congrats.
(yep, that's it. bask in the nihilism)

classFeature.name: Good Plain Folk
entries: You are proficient in the use of artisan's tools as weapons, and add your expertise bonus when attacking with them. The deal 1d4 of whatever damage type is appropriate for the tool.
All of your ability scores are 10, and cannot be naturally increased. You are nothing special.

classFeature.name: Callow Youth
entries: And yet you know you're destined for greatness! You can give yourself advantage on any d20 roll by gritting your teeth and looking danger in the eye. You regain the use of this ability when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: The Darnedest Thing
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can survive the adventuring life through sheer coincidence.
